poem:
**Market Movements**

Iron melodies hum from vaults of trade,  
as hopeful whispers ride on currency winds.  
Two giants nod and speak in weighted tones,  
lifting the concrete seas, their oaths like sails.  
Numbers dance in invisible displays,  
a ballet of trust and caution,  
where iron ore and promises  
exchange glances in Geneva's dawn.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Stock markets lifted by ‘productive’ US-China trade talks – business live 7.59am BST Treasury secretary Scott Bessent and US trade representative Jamieson Greer are about to hold a press briefing now in Geneva, to discuss last weekend’s talks with China…. 7.50am BST Iron ore prices have risen too, after the US and China reported progress in their trade talks. The benchmark June iron ore contract on the Singapore Exchange is up 2.2%, to around $99". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Stock markets lifted by ‘productive’ US-China trade talks – business live 7.59am BST Treasury secretary Scott Bessent and US trade representative Jamieson Greer are about to hold a press briefing now in Geneva, to discuss last weekend’s talks with China…. 7.50am BST Iron ore prices have risen too, after the US and China reported progress in their trade talks. The benchmark June iron ore contract on the Singapore Exchange is up 2.2%, to around $99
